titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wranglers Memorabilia collection 1910-1993
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Cheryl Gunselman.

publicationstmt.publisher: Washington State University Libraries Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Doug Lambeth. 2012
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English. English.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection consists of a nearly-complete set of annual programs of The Wranglers, photographs, and a scrapbook. In addition to event schedules for each academic year, the annual programs include lists of current and former members. The collection also includes a small number of programs from the group's annual Ladies' Night banquet, and programs from a Wranglers group at Kansas State College.

bioghist.p: The Wranglers, a social club formed in 1910 at Pullman, Washington, began as a small group of male faculty members and senior administrators. The membership was fixed at 20 individuals. Beginning in 1910, they met regularly during the academic year for programs they called "Wrangles," featuring presentations by members. By the 1990s, the group had expanded with a larger membership including at least one woman.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a nearly-complete set of annual programs of The Wranglers, photographs, and a scrapbook. In addition to event schedules for each academic year, the annual programs include lists of current and former members. The collection also includes a small number of programs from the group's annual Ladies' Night banquet, and programs from a Wranglers group at Kansas State College.

arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in a single series.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: The materials in Box 1 of this collection were transferred from the MASC vertical file (VF 1875) in 2011; the scrapbook was donated by Mike Costello on behalf of the Wranglers in the same year.

processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Cheryl Gunselman.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
